content:
Sure, here is how the pipeline can be split into two pipelines:

---

Initial Investor Pipeline #1:

1. Lead Captured: The lead is captured from a lead source, such as a conference, newsletter, personal connection, or website.
2. Lead Tagged: The lead is tagged based on the source, accreditation status, and investment level.
3. Lead Imported to CRM: The lead is imported to the customer relationship management (CRM) system.
4. Lead Enriched and Scored: The lead is enriched with additional information and scored based on engagement and other factors.
5. Initial Contact Made: The first contact is made with the lead, typically via email or phone.
6. Investment Opportunity Discussed: The investment opportunity is discussed with the lead to determine their interest level.
7. Follow-up Meeting Scheduled: A follow-up meeting is scheduled with the lead to further discuss the investment opportunity.
8. Investment Presentation Conducted: The investment opportunity is presented to the lead, typically via a private placement memorandum (PPM).
9. Investor Commitment Obtained: The lead decides to invest in the opportunity and provides a commitment.

---

The second pipeline will include stages #10 through #20. We will call this "Investor Onboarding Pipeline #2":

---

Investor Onboarding Pipeline #2:

10. Investor Documents Sent: The investor documents, including the PPM and subscription agreement, are sent to the investor for review.
11. Subscription Agreement Signed: The investor signs the subscription agreement, indicating their commitment to invest.
12. Capital Call Made: The capital call is made, requesting the investor to transfer the funds to the investment account.
13. Funds Received: The investor transfers the funds to the investment account.
14. Investor Onboarded: The investor is onboarded to the investment opportunity.
15. Investor Added to CRM: The investor is added to the CRM system for future communication and tracking.
16. Investor Follow-up Meeting Scheduled: A follow-up meeting is scheduled with the investor to discuss future investment opportunities.
17. Investor Referral Requested: The investor is asked to refer other potential investors to the company.
18. Investor Education Content Sent: Educational content, such as articles or webinars, is sent to the investor to keep them engaged and informed.
19. Investor Meeting Conducted: A meeting is conducted with the investor to discuss their investment progress and address any concerns or questions.
20. Investor Feedback Requested: Feedback is requested from the investor on their experience with the investment and the company.
